section.hand:
To my L. T
re
r De
c
11 1591

addressleaf.section:
1591 xj Decem
b
To my L. Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please yo
r
good L. I have heerewith inclosed
e copie
of an other letter from
e Emperors Ambas sadors to the
General states. The letter was receaved and read by suche
as are autorised unto it in
e absence of the Deputies. But
because their meeting is adjorned till
e 20 of De
c
and
their appearance is commonly about fortnight after, and
perhaps in regard of this poursuit of the Emperor, will be
further prolonged, there is no other answear made unto the
Ambassadors, then I have sent unto you w
t
the letter: w
ch
is a note of Receate, from
e Greffier of the states, delivered
to the Trumpet that brought
e letter hither. Heere is
great inquirie among many, to heare how her Ma
tie
is affected
in the cause: but I knowe not directly what to answear
unto them, not having yet receaved any instruction from
yo
r
L: w
ch
maketh me sparing in delivering my opinion.
Howbeit I doe allwaies incline to that w
ch
heeretofore I
have bin willed to persude, That her Hig
nes
is unwilling
to hearken to any Treaty, unles it may be general, aswell
for her self, as for them, and also for France. Of
the Enemies actions in these contries, heere is nothing cer-
taine: It is only reported that the D. of Parma is depar-
ted from Brussels towardes Mons in Henault, to goe
forward for France: albeit his voiage thither, is greatly
doubted of many.
Hage. De
c
11 1591.
